Author: Alright#0419
Content: Am trying to convert compressed WIF to uncompressed WIF. Could someone point me to a general explanation of the math behind this? Can't find any good resources

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is some way to calculate the other half from the compressed wif, google should find it

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
```
‚ÄúUncompressed‚Äù WIF private key:

0x80 + 32 byte raw private key + 4 byte checksum

‚ÄúCompressed‚Äù WIF private key:

0x80 + 32 byte raw private key + 0x01 + 4 byte checksum
```
found this from searching, but I can't seem to get it to work as described

Author: Alright#0419
Content: does that seem correct?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: don't have a problem getting raw private key, just not sure how to proceed from there

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: uncompressed is 64 bytes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, the wif

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is the pubkey that is 32 vs 64

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, there is a 0x01 added for compressed

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
```
def WIFconv(byte, WIF):
    first_encode = base58.b58decode(private_key_WIF)
    private_key_full = binascii.hexlify(first_encode)
    private_key = private_key_full[2:-8]
    raw_privkey = private_key.decode("utf-8")
    extended_key = byte+raw_privkey
    first_sha256 = hashlib.sha256(binascii.unhexlify(extended_key)).hexdigest()
    second_sha256 = hashlib.sha256(binascii.unhexlify(first_sha256)).hexdigest()
    # add checksum to end of extended key
    final_key = extended_key+second_sha256[:8]
    # Wallet Import Format = base 58 encoded final_key
    WIF = base58.b58encode(binascii.unhexlify(final_key))
    return(WIF.decode("utf-8"))
```
this works fine for converting between prefixes, but I'm trying to rework it to convert compressed to uncompressed. Based on what that says, I assumed this would work, but it doesn't
```
def WIFconv(byte, WIF):
    first_encode = base58.b58decode(private_key_WIF)
    private_key_full = binascii.hexlify(first_encode)
    private_key = private_key_full[2:-8]
    raw_privkey = private_key.decode("utf-8")
    extended_key = byte+raw_privkey+'01'
    first_sha256 = hashlib.sha256(binascii.unhexlify(extended_key)).hexdigest()
    second_sha256 = hashlib.sha256(binascii.unhexlify(first_sha256)).hexdigest()
    # add checksum to end of extended key
    final_key = extended_key+second_sha256[:8]
    # Wallet Import Format = base 58 encoded final_key
    WIF = base58.b58encode(binascii.unhexlify(final_key))
    return(WIF.decode("utf-8"))
```

Author: Alright#0419
Content: `    extended_key = byte+raw_privkey` vs `    extended_key = byte+raw_privkey+'01'`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I've tried it before and after sha steps, wasn't sure if it was meant to be part of the checksum or not, neither seems to work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: iguana has code that generates wif from privkey

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
```
def WIFconv(byte, WIF):
    first_encode = base58.b58decode(private_key_WIF)
    private_key_full = binascii.hexlify(first_encode)
    private_key = private_key_full[2:-8]
    raw_privkey = private_key.decode("utf-8")
    extended_key = byte+raw_privkey
    first_sha256 = hashlib.sha256(binascii.unhexlify(extended_key[:66])).hexdigest()
    second_sha256 = hashlib.sha256(binascii.unhexlify(first_sha256)).hexdigest()
    # add checksum to end of extended key
    final_key = extended_key[:66]+second_sha256[:8]
    # Wallet Import Format = base 58 encoded final_key
    WIF = base58.b58encode(binascii.unhexlify(final_key))
    return(WIF.decode("utf-8"))
```
compressed to uncompressed
